phrases: Make sure you get your fill of it!
You will not be touching any warm surfaces for a while, after this.
Let us do this in Antarctica, too.
I do not know what this trip will mean in the end.
We will be taking time off from school, missing tests...
It might even affect our entrance exams.
we are no longer high school students who can never take a step forward.
We are not 17-year-olds and 16-year-olds who try but accomplish nothing.
The world really is big, is not it?
Hey, guys, I am taking a picture!
A Place Further Than the Universe
High school girls are conducting intervews!!
We are not live, so you can do it again...
They said the waves were going to get pretty rough...
We really need to be efficient with our time.
They wanted us to help out later, right?
Why did not you wake me?
Then you need to wake me harder!
It is not uncommon among women.
I would actually say it is typical.
we will be stopping at places in the ocean known as stations
We have tons of equipment on board to help us with that!
This is a water sampler and a CTD monitor.
This is a water sampler and a CTD monitor, huh?
We will be gathering rocks like these
and performing geological surveys in Antarctica.
We will investigate the stratum several thousand meters down
to learn more about the conditions on primordial Earth.
Would you just listen to her?
Yeah, yeah, we have been waiting!
Well, with whatever we have, anyway.
Now, if you do not mind, start up on those.
This is why I wanted to bring a peeler!
There are still so many more to go...
But this kind of thing is fun, do not you think?
You like grunt work, huh, Kimari?
Seems like it takes the four of you just to reach one horsepower.
It is clear you do not help out at home very often.
We do not want you getting hurt.
I am a pro, after all.
I am usually a lunch lady.
I am constantly thinking up and preparing dishes
for picky eaters like you guys.
Anyway, work hard, so you can get up on deck soon.
From 1100 hours to 1700 hours, training is permitted on-deck.
It means we are allowed to train topside.
In other words, we can go outside and get some exercise.
I will take you up when you are done.
It is sort of a duty for expedition members.
W-We are going to run here?
If they announce clockwise, you would go this way.
If they announce counterclockwise, you go that way.
The direction changes by day, so be careful.
About how long do we have to run?
But as we have told you over and over, stamina is crucial on an expedition.
You might be working all day in sub-zero conditions,
so you need strong bodies to meet the challenge.
If you run out of stamina and pass out,
not only will you not contribute anything,
you will be an active drag on the people around you.
You do not want to get to Antarctica to be a drag, right?
We will do our best, too!
Kimari-san does not realize, does she?
She will catch on soon enough.
You have walked around here countless times, have not you?
But... everyone else... goes so fast...
Even she can run that fast...
but I guess she still has tons of stamina.
By the time we get to Antarctica, we will be Amazons!
It will not be that easy...
Yuzu, can you not lift your arms?
If you do anything, I will just kill you...
So this is a seawater bath...
Seawater is more permeating than I expected.
I think that is why everyone cuts their hair.
And the men shave their heads...
Okay, maybe we should cut it!
The boat has barber facilities, right?
Not even if the fate of the world depended on it.
I cut my own bangs all the time!
Missed meal cards go here Already eaten: Black
Because you did not wash off properly in the shower.
But I did not have time!
Are these the ones we peeled?
Have we forgotten to do anything else?
Do not we have to do that at a certain time, too?
It is because you two were playing around in the bath.
Take responsibility and go do it.
Wait, but what about our dinner?
But did not we pick someone to do it because it seemed easy to forget?
As I recall, we did rock-paper-scissors...
Regarding use of fresh water Fresh water baths permitted during ship-wide training (Salt water baths are allowed, too!)
What do you mean, that will do it?
You actually sat there and ate your whole meal!
I still made it in time, so what is the problem?
They kept us busy a lot longer than I expected.
And it all starts again tomorrow.
You think we will hold out?
We just have to do our best, right?
We do not have any other choice.
When using the toilet, turn this valve counterclockwise to flush.
After flushing, please close the valve.
But we were totally fine before.
Of course it will wear off eventually.
I have never been on a boat this long.
You need to take medicine and get a good night's rest.
I know you probably do not have an appetite,
and you are afraid that if you eat it will just come back up.
But if you do not eat, you will just keep losing stamina.
If it gets bad enough, we might have to give you an IV supplement.
If that happens, none of your training will mean anything.
If we do not want to be a drag in Antarctica,
we have to eat, whether we like it or not!
Yuzuki-chan, did it all come up for you, too?
Just stop for a little bit!
They said they are collecting seawater.
Yumiko-san said we would get used to it eventually.
Winning team gets a steak dinner!!
Pictured: the steaks from three years ago
If you are planning on winning, please bring your provided army -n-i-c-e- knife, please.
You were given an army knife for cutting steak
They have probably been on boats so often
Yeah, there is no way I can run...
But it is a little better outside, with the wind, at least...
I could probably manage it if not for the rocking...
I wanted to see the whales...
They said earlier that they were in sight.
Because she was focusing on a single point, right?
Just thinking about it makes me want to puke.
I looked in your room earlier,
and it looked like you were not ready at all.
Though we set that record a long time ago.
The last time I came here, it felt to me like we rocked so far,
When you go to Antarctica, you must surpass these things...
Earth is a water planet, remember?
It spins on its axis, and that creates wind and water currents.
so those block the currents and weaken them.
But around this area of the southern hemisphere,
there is no land in the way,
so there is nothing to interrupt the current.
Mom said they were going to plow their way right through it.
I do not know all the details, but pretty long.
Your insides will go woo, like on a roller coaster!
But do you want to go on one now?
Though I like this kind of thing... the feeling, like I am fighting.
That was the biggest one yet, right?
I think that was about 15 degrees.
Here it comes, here it comes, here it comes, here it comes!
You would better stay in bed.
But the blood is rushing to my head...
No getting to sleep tonight, huh?
You think we will really make it to Antarctica?
We are on a boat going there.
but we might not be able to do anything once we get there.
Everyone has so much stamina, and they can handle the boat...
It is almost like we are completely different organisms.
Then we have to become stronger, too!
You really think we can be like them?
We just have to do our best, right?
We do not have any other choice.
But we chose to be here.
I think I am getting used to throwing up.
Yeah, when I get home I can tell them...
Yeah, I will tell them it was really fun!
I am sure that when this trip is over, that is how we will feel!
I would like to go outside for a bit!
This is the ocean we are crossing, huh?
To a continent of ice protected by storms and raging waves!
We really did choose to go there, did not we?
Because we saw the whales yesterday!
Sounds like you have gotten used to the boat.
Once we make landfall, you are going to get landsick.
The view is a single sheet of blue.
I strain my eyes, but the horizon is all I can see.
I know I was probably hearing the sounds of the boat,
but that overwhelming scenery seemed to render everything silent.
I was looking out on an infinite world reminiscent of outer space.
In that moment, we knew for sure.
We are back, are not we?
Though it will be a long time before we are even opening the front door.
